meanings.definition: Oblatory: relating to or constituting an obligation
meanings.sent1: The oblatory task of feeding the pets every morning is important.
meanings.sent2: It is oblatory for students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent3: The oblatory chore of taking out the trash became a daily routine.
meanings.sent4: Her oblatory commitment to volunteer at the shelter was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The oblatory nature of paying bills reminded him of his responsibilities.

meanings.definition: Oblatory: required or necessary as a duty or responsibility
meanings.sent1: Wearing a helmet while biking is oblatory for safety.
meanings.sent2: It is oblatory to follow the rules of the road while driving.
meanings.sent3: His oblatory task of doing the dishes often led to family jokes.
meanings.sent4: The oblatory need to study for exams was clear to all students.
meanings.sent5: The oblatory attendance at the meeting was crucial for decision-making.
